findings.title: Use of spot reserves in DEX pool
findings.description: The stake function allows to stake LP tokens for pools that contain the MIC token.

findings.title: Unauthorized mint of staking contract tokens
findings.description: Functions stakeFor and collectRewardsFor are not protected and anyone can call them.

findings.title: Invalid value of _currentPeriodRewardsAmount variable
findings.description: The _notifyRewardAmount_ function sets _currentPeriodRewardsAmount_ variable to __amount_ while there is a case when rewards from the previous period remain and are taken into account when calculating the reward rate.

findings.title: Invalid value returned by the _collectedRewardsInCurrentPeriod variable_
findings.description: The _notifyRewardAmount_ function sets _collectedRewardsInCurrentPeriod_ variable to _0_, and this variable is never increased on the rewards withdrawal.

findings.title: Unused inheritance
findings.description: The MintStaking and DividendToken contracts inherit from Ownable contract. However, the onlyOwner modifier is not used in the contractsâ€™ code.

findings.title: Floating pragma
findings.description: The audited code uses a floating pragma, which allows compiling contracts with various versions of the compiler.

findings.title: Draft version contract usage
findings.description: The DividendToken inherits from a draft version of ERC20Permit contract. Contract drafts may not be exhaustively tested, updated or changed.

findings.title: Inconsistent variable naming
findings.description: All but one constructor parameters in the DividentToken#L18 contract are prefixed with the underscore symbol. It is important to be consistent when naming variables.

findings.title: Non-self-explanatory variable names
findings.description: The userDepositsAmount variable in _addDeposit function represents the number of deposits while its name suggests the value of deposits.

findings.title: Favor push over pull
findings.description: The withdraw function calls collectRewards function. It is recommended to favor pulling tokens over pushing tokens.

findings.title: Unnecessary view function usage
findings.description: The lastTimeRewardApplicable function returns the current block.timestamp. This value can be obtained directly, depending on the need.
